components.description: A heart shaded completely black. May be used to express morbidity, sorrow, or a form of dark humor, but despite the color remains most commonly used for love and affection.
components.title: Black Heart

description: A heart shaded completely black. May be used to express morbidity, sorrow, or a form of dark humor, but despite the color remains most commonly used for love and affection.
title: Black Heart

version.description:
The Unicode Consortium accepted the following emoji 72 emojis for Unicode 9.0. This update was released on June 21, 2016. Most vendors added support for this update within the 2016 calendar year. Sample images and more about Unicode 9.0.

Emoji 4.0 was published in late 2016, which added additional emoji professions.

New in Unicode 9

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Heart symbol
emoji_net_data.definition: A heart shaded completely black. May be used to express morbidity, sorrow, or a form of dark humor. Not to be confused with theÂ Heavy Black  http://emojipedia.org/black-heart/
emoji_net_data.name: black heart

bn:00101517a: Highly offensive; arousing aversion or disgust
Of something highly offensive; causing aversion or disgust.
Loathsome; disgusting; as, a foul disease.

bn:00098480a: Being of the achromatic color of maximum darkness; having little or no hue owing to absorption of almost all incident light
Absorbing all light and reflecting none; dark and hueless.
Dark and colourless; not reflecting visible light.

bn:00010816n: Black is the color of coal, ebony, and of outer space.
The quality or state of the achromatic color of least lightness (bearing the least resemblance to white)
The state, property or quality of being black.

bn:00032050n: Evil, in a general context, is taken as the absence or complete opposite of that which is ascribed as being good.
The quality or state of being evil.
Evil is a term used to indicate acts or qualities involving needless or wanton harm or destruction, or the deliberate violation of some accepted moral codes of behavior.
The quality of being morally wrong in principle or practice
